title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns healthy to Bruins' training camp after missing 65 games with a fractured patella last season.
Lindholm aims to bolster the Bruins' defense, potentially improving their weak power play which ranked 29th in the NHL.
Despite past injuries, Lindholm is confident and excited to contribute to the Bruins' lineup this upcoming season.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bills QB Josh Allen praised Patriots QB Drake Maye, describing him as a bright and talented young athlete.
Allen and Maye developed a good relationship over the past year, spending time together in the offseason.
Maye, a 2024 NFL Draft No. 3 pick, had mixed performance in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders with 287 passing yards.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The MBTA introduced a Boston and Maine Railroad-designed train with maroon and yellow colors on its Commuter Rail.
Two additional trains honoring New Haven Railroad and New York Central Railroad will join by the end of the year.
The refurbished trains include updates such as remote monitoring, cameras, and modern brake and control systems.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Cole Strange signed by Dolphins from Browns' practice squad ahead of Sunday's game.
Strange was New England's 29th pick in 2022, starting 29 games before struggling with injuries and form.
Miami needs line reinforcements after right guard James Daniels' injury, with Strange a potential starter.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will offer free tuition for undergraduate students with family incomes under $150,000 starting next fall.
Families earning less than $60,000 will receive financial aid packages with no student loans, covering full tuition and need.
The program, funded by donations, aims to increase diversity and reduce financial barriers to education at Tufts.

title: Aunt now caring for child of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A 1-year-old girl, Madeline, will be raised by her aunt after her parents' deaths in a Watertown murder-suicide.
David Minasvand shot Karine Asatryan and Nadia Abrahamian before taking his own life, according to Middlesex County DA Marian Ryan.
A fundraiser supporting Madeline has raised over $37,000 to cover baby supplies, medical care, and future education.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins GM Don Sweeney believes this season's team will be more competitive if they can remain healthy.
Sweeney confirmed the Bruins will start the season without a captain but may appoint one as the season progresses.
Several younger players and recent signings are expected to compete for significant roles in the Bruins' lineup.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants across three states featured in New York Times' top 50 list.
Boston's McGonagle's pub and La Padrona Italian restaurant were highlighted alongside restaurants from Maine and Connecticut.
Notable omissions include Rhode Island, Vermont, and New Hampshire, although Rhode Island was recognized previously.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots waived second-year cornerback DJ James, who excelled during preseason but played limited snaps in the season opener.
James was a sixth-round pick by Seattle in 2024 and joined New England's practice squad before impressing in training camp.
New England's cornerback options were limited with injuries to Christian Gonzalez and Charles Woods during their loss to Las Vegas.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may get married in Rhode Island. Here’s everything we know about the possible wedding plans.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may marry in Rhode Island by the end of 2026, possibly at Swift's Westerly mansion.
The couple, both 35, announced their engagement with a joint Instagram post in August 2025.
Renovations worth $1.7 million at Swift's Holiday House in Westerly were reported earlier this year.
